question_text: What does CSS stand for?
answer_choices: Computer Style Sheets
Cascading Style Sheets
Creative Style Sheets
Coded Style Sheets

question_text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
answer_choices: text-color
color
font-color
text-style

question_text: How do you select an element with id 'myElement' in CSS?
answer_choices: .myElement
element.myElement
#myElement
element#myElement

question_text: What does 'CSS specificity' refer to?
answer_choices: The order of CSS rules in a stylesheet
The ease of writing CSS rules
The weight of a CSS rule in relation to others determining which styles are applied to an element
The degree of separation between HTML and CSS

question_text: What is the purpose of 'float' property in CSS?
answer_choices: To apply animation effects to an element
To allow an element to float to the left or right of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it
To vertically align an element within its container
To increase the font size of an element

question_text: What is the 'box model' in CSS?
answer_choices: A layout technique to create flexible and responsive designs
A method for organizing CSS code into modular components
A set of properties to style text within a container
A model that describes how elements are rendered on a web page as a box with content, padding, border, and margin

question_text: How can you center an element horizontally in CSS?
answer_choices: Using the 'align: center;' property
Using the 'margin: 0 auto;' property
Using the 'text-align: center;' property
Using the 'float: center;' property

question_text: What does the CSS property 'display: none;' do?
answer_choices: Displays the element as an inline element
Reduces the opacity of the element to make it partially transparent
Hides the element completely, including its space
Applies a border around the element

question_text: What is the purpose of 'media queries' in CSS?
answer_choices: To target specific HTML elements
To create animations and transitions
To apply different styles for different devices or screen sizes
To define the layout of a webpage

question_text: What is the CSS property used to set the background color of an element?
answer_choices: color
background
background-color
bgcolor

question_text: What is the 'box-sizing' property in CSS used for?
answer_choices: To specify the positioning of an element
To define the shape of a box
To control how the total width and height of an element is calculated
To apply a border around the element

question_text: How do you apply a shadow to an element in CSS?
answer_choices: Using the 'shadow' property
Using the 'text-shadow' property
Using the 'outline' property
Using the 'box-shadow' property

question_text: What is the purpose of 'z-index' property in CSS?
answer_choices: To prevent conflicts between different CSS rules
To control the transparency of an element
To define the width and height of an element
To specify the stack order of an element

question_text: What does the 'position: relative;' property do in CSS?
answer_choices: Makes an element stick to the top of the page
Allows an element to be positioned relative to its normal position
Creates a fixed position element
Aligns an element to the right side of its container

question_text: What is the 'flex-direction' property used for in CSS flexbox?
answer_choices: To control the spacing between flex items
To define the direction of the main axis in a flex container
To specify the order of flex items
To rotate an element around its axis

question_text: How do you include comments in CSS?
answer_choices: // This is a comment
<!-- This is a comment -->
# This is a comment
/* This is a comment */

question_text: What is the purpose of the 'overflow' property in CSS?
answer_choices: To make an element semi-transparent
To add a scroll bar to an element
To control what happens if the content of an element exceeds its size
To specify the order of overlapping elements

question_text: How do you group multiple selectors in CSS?
answer_choices: Enclose them in curly braces
Precede them with the '+' symbol
Separate them with commas
Use the 'group' keyword

question_text: What is the purpose of 'flexbox' in CSS?
answer_choices: To apply gradients to backgrounds
To create 3D transformations
To provide a more efficient way to layout, align, and distribute space among items in a container, even when their size is unknown or dynamic
To define custom fonts for text

question_text: What does 'SCSS' stand for in CSS?
answer_choices: Styled CSS
Simplified CSS
Standardized CSS
Sassy CSS

question_text: What is the difference between 'inline' and 'block' elements in CSS?
answer_choices: Block elements cannot contain other elements, while inline elements can
Inline elements are always centered, while block elements are not
Inline elements do not start on a new line and only take up as much width as necessary, while block elements start on a new line and take up the full width available
Block elements are only visible in certain media queries

question_text: What is 'CSS Grid' used for?
answer_choices: To create 3D transformations
To define custom fonts for text
To create complex layouts with rows and columns
To add animation effects to elements

question_text: What is the purpose of the 'transition' property in CSS?
answer_choices: To add a border around an element
To change the font of an element
To smoothly animate changes in CSS properties
To position an element on the page

question_text: What does the CSS property 'position: absolute;' do?
answer_choices: Positions an element relative to its parent element
Positions an element relative to the viewport, meaning it stays fixed while scrolling
Positions an element relative to its nearest positioned ancestor
Positions an element relative to its normal position in the document flow

question_text: What is the purpose of 'CSS variables'?
answer_choices: To define custom fonts for text
To create 3D transformations
To store and reuse values throughout a stylesheet
To add animation effects to elements

question_text: What is the 'flex-wrap' property used for in CSS flexbox?
answer_choices: To control the spacing between flex items
To define the direction of the main axis in a flex container
To specify the order of flex items
To control whether flex items are forced onto one line or can wrap onto multiple lines

question_text: What is the purpose of 'CSS preprocessors'?
answer_choices: To create 3D transformations
To define custom fonts for text
To provide additional functionality and features to CSS, such as variables, nesting, and mixins
To add animation effects to elements

question_text: What is the purpose of 'CSS frameworks'?
answer_choices: To create 3D transformations
To define custom fonts for text
To provide a pre-built set of styles and components for faster and easier web development
To add animation effects to elements

question_text: What is the purpose of 'CSS animations'?
answer_choices: To create 3D transformations
To define custom fonts for text
To add animation effects to elements
To provide a pre-built set of styles and components for faster and easier web development
